conclusion: Initial analysis of the problem setup and components involved.
Description of the horizontal metal ring with radius r=0.2 m and two metal rods placed along the diameter.
Description of the rods rotating uniformly with angular velocity ω=600 rad/s and the presence of a uniform magnetic field B1 in the left half of the ring.
Explanation of the rotating rods connected to a vertical rotating shaft OO' and their connection to parallel horizontal metal tracks separated by distance l1.
Description of the capacitor with capacitance C=0.09 F connected between the tracks via a single-pole double-throw switch S.
Description of the region on the left side of the capacitor with width l1, length l2, and uniform magnetic field B2.
Description of the metal rod ab placed perpendicularly to the tracks near the left edge within the magnetic field region.
Description of the insulated tracks outside the magnetic field region smoothly connected to the metal tracks.
Description of the '[' shaped metal frame fcde placed on the horizontal section of the insulated tracks.
Description of the lengths and masses of the rod ab and the '[' shaped frame, and the lengths of de and cf.
Description of the resistance of the rod ab and the cd side of the '[' shaped frame, and the negligible resistance of other components.
Description of the smooth tracks and the motion of the rod ab remaining perpendicular to the tracks.
Description of the initial connection of switch S to terminal 1 and the subsequent discharge of the capacitor.
Description of the ejection of rod ab from the magnetic field and its attachment to the '[' shaped frame.
Description of the rise of the center of mass of the frame abcd on the inclined track.
Objective to determine the amount of charge Q on the capacitor and identify the positively charged plate.
Understanding the initial setup and charging of the capacitor by analyzing the emf generated by rotating rods.
Calculation of the emf induced in a rod rotating in a magnetic field using Faraday's law.
Calculation of the emf induced in each rod as ε = 12 V.
Determination that the total emf is 12 V due to two rods in parallel.
Calculation of the current I during charging as I = 24/R0.
